qas.question: What Hanoverian leader lost the Battle of Hastenbeck?
What country won the battle at Hanover?
How would one describe the future participation of Hanover?

answers.text: Convention removed Hanover and Brunswick from the war

qas.question: How did Frederick respond to the defeat at Hanover?

answers.text: Frederick sent urgent requests to Britain for more substantial assistance

context: This problem was compounded when the main Hanoverian army under <a0_0>Cumberland<a0_0/> was defeated at the Battle of Hastenbeck and forced to surrender entirely at the Convention of Klosterzeven following a <a1_0>French<a1_0/> Invasion of Hanover. The <a2_0>Convention removed Hanover and Brunswick from the war<a2_0/>, leaving the Western approach to Prussian territory extremely vulnerable. <a3_0>Frederick sent urgent requests to Britain for more substantial assistance<a3_0/>, as he was now without any outside military support for his forces in Germany.
